text: mr. president you're about to fly to
Kenya to your ancestral home
given the al-shabaab attacks on the
Westgate Mall and University University
I'm sure your Secret Service could have
suggested other countries for you to
visit but you wanted to go to Kenya well
I think it is important first of all
that the president United States
underscores our commitment to partnering
with countries around the world and then
we're not intimidated by terrorist
organizations second the
counterterrorism cooperation between the
United States and Kenya and Uganda and
other countries in East Africa is very
strong and you're going to talk about
entrepreneurship at the summit in
Nairobi is there any link between
security and entrepreneurship I think
there is I believe that when people see
opportunity when they have a sense of
control of their own destiny then
they're less vulnerable to the
propaganda and twisted ideologies the
more we can encourage entrepreneurship
particularly for young people the more
they have hope you famously said when
you went to Africa I think when you
first became president you know what we
needed strong institutions and not
strongmen now going to Ethiopia whether
it's effectively no opposition in
Parliament you're going to Kenya where
the International Criminal Court is
still investigating certain members of
the government which seems kind of
hardly ideal institutions they're not
ideal institutions but what we found is
is that when we combine blunt talk with
engagement that gives us the best
opportunity to influence and open up
space for civil society we want to make
sure that we're there so that we can
have this conversation and point in a
better direction well haven't the
Chinese got there first in Africa you're
gonna go to the African Union building
which was built with Chinese money
you're gonna travel at all Chinese built
road to go to go past endless Chinese
traders on those roads well what is true
is that China has been able to funnel
awful lot of money into Africa basically
in exchange for
raw materials that are being extracted
from Africa and what is certainly true
is that the United States has to have a
presence to promote the values that we
care about we welcome Chinese aid into
Africa I think we think that's a good
thing we don't want to discourage it I'm
going to suggest there may be one other
difficult issue when you're there unless
the issue of homosexuality gay marriage
after the Supreme Court ruling I mean
the deputy president in Kenya who you're
going to meet mr. ruto he said we have
heard that in the US they have allowed
gay relations and other dirty things
yeah well I disagree with him on that
door in my last trip to Africa I was
very blunt about my belief that
everybody deserves fair treatment equal
treatment in the eyes of the law in the
state and that includes gays lesbians
transgender persons I am NOT a fan of
discrimination and bullying of anybody
on the basis of race on the basis of
religion on the basis of sexual
orientation or gender
but there's the view from the top of the
